The Kinſlạða

The Kinſlạða is a genealogical record of The Dọlita

Generation 1

  • Dọður, God of Death
    • Ex-Husband of Lịðin
  • Lịðin, Goddess of Life
    • Ex-Wife of Dọður
    • Sister of Tị́mur
  • Tị́mur, God of Time
    • Brother of Lịðin

Generation 2A (The Ụrla)

  • Kwẹlin, Weaver of Fate
    • Daughter of Tị́mur
  • Hạdin, Writer of Fate
    • Daughter of Tị́mur
  • Nẹtur, Trimmer of Fate
    • Son of Tị́mur

Generation 2B

  • Ẹldur, God of Energy
    • Son of Lịðin
  • Yọ́dur, God of Earth
    • Son of Dọður
  • Lụ́din, Goddess of Air
    • Daughter of Dọður
  • Brạður, God of Fire
    • Son of Lịðin
  • Vạdin, Goddess of Water
    • Daughter of Lịðin

Generation 3

  • Fyẹlur, God of Mountains
    • Son of Yọ́dur
  • Kẹnur, God of Canyons & Cliffs
    • Son of Yọ́dur
  • Pạtin, Goddess of Plants
    • Daughter of Lụ́din
  • Dọ́rin, Goddess of Creatures
    • Daughter of Ẹldur
  • Gạldin, Goddess of Magic
    • Daughter of Ẹldur
  • Strị́ður, God of War
    • Son of Brạður
  • Fọ́rmur, God of Protective Warmth
    • Son of Brạður
  • Frịðin, Goddess of Peace
    • Daughter of Vạdin
  • Fụrlin, Goddess of Travel
    • Daughter of Vạdin

Generation 4

  • Fẹlkilur, God of Volcanoes
    • Son of Fyẹlur
  • Hẹ́lin, Goddess of Caves
    • Daughter of Fyẹlur
  • Gọ́lgemin, Goddess of Alchemy
    • Daughter of Pạtin
  • Efkịmin, Goddess of Chemistry
    • Daughter of Pạtin
  • Skịmźur, God of Monsters
    • Son of Dọ́rin
  • Dyur, God of Animals
    • Son of Dọ́rin
  • Ọpfin, Goddess of Invention
    • Daughter of Gạldin
  • Ọnlegur, God of Construction
    • Son of Gạldin
  • Ekſprẹŋur, God of Explosives
    • Son of Strị́ður
  • Strẹfnur, God of Strategy
    • Son of Strị́ður
  • Lạkbin, Goddess of Healing
    • Daughter of Frịðin
  • Kọgur, God of Art
    • Son of Frịðin

Generation 5

  • Rạvin, Goddess of Lava
    • Daughter of Fẹlkilur
  • Braị́nur, God of Burning
    • Son of Fẹlkilur
  • Frẹkur, God of Fear
    • Son of Hẹ́lin
  • Pụrlin, Goddess of Wealth
    • Daughter of Hẹ́lin
  • Kụ̈fnur, God of Artifacts
    • Son of Gọ́lgemin
  • Pị́kin, Goddess of Potions
    • Daughter of Gọ́lgemin
  • Sị́rilur, God of Acids
    • Son of Efkịmin
  • Ụpgoðin, Goddess of Discovery
    • Daughter of Efkịmin
  • Dọlin, Goddess of Air Animals
    • Daughter of Dyur
  • Yọ́rdin, Goddess of Land Animals
    • Daughter of Dyur
  • Śọ́dur, God of Sea Animals
    • Son of Dyur
  • Ọditur, God of Undead
    • Son of Skịmźur
  • Pụ́kin, Goddess of Demons
    • Daughter of Skịmźur
  • Grẹ́ndur, God of Intelligence
    • Son of Ọpfin
  • Skọpkin, Goddess of Creativity
    • Daughter of Ọpfin
  • Sþịnur, God of Carpentry
    • Son of Ọnlegur
  • Ạrktin, Goddess of Architecture
    • Daughter of Ọnlegur
  • Bịſur, God of Firearms
    • Son of Ekſprẹŋur
  • Sprịŋur, God of Bombs
    • Son of Ekſprẹŋur
  • Kạrtlin, Goddess of Cartography
    • Daughter of Strẹfnur
  • Nọkvur, God of Precision
    • Son of Strẹfnur
  • Skụrðin, Goddess of Surgery
    • Daughter of Lạkbin
  • Mẹcur, God of Medicine
    • Son of Lạkbin
  • Rịſtilin, Goddess of Carving
    • Daughter of Kọgur
  • Mọ́lin, Goddess of Paint
    • Daughter of Kọgur

Generation 6

  • These Deities govern specific areas; islands, landmarks, lakes, oceans, etc.

Mạkra

  • Not Deities
  • Favoured mortals of a deity, giving them a fraction of their power
  • Each deity has their own system or reasoning for choosing a Mạkra
    • Some like to follow certain bloodlines, while others do not
    • Some deities turn their favoured mortal into a Mạkra when they reach adulthood, some when the mortal proves themself, and others do so in the mortal’s time of need
    • Some enjoy the Chaos
  • Orders of magnitude stronger than a Wizard, but much weaker than actual gods
  • Each Deity has a Mạkra
  • This status grants a mortal significant political power
  • Most historical heroes are Mạkra
  • Those that aren't are even more legendary
  • Being gifted power by multiple deities is extraordinarily rare, but not impossible
  • There have only been several in history
  • Once, and only once, there was a Mạkra of Dọður, Lịðin and Tị́mur, prior to The Vạlda
  • This Mạkra was The First
  • When a Mạkra dies, a new Mạkra is chosen
  • A Mạkra can lose their status if they do something that angers their patron, without a reasonable explanation
